page.title: 14Voluntary Community Care
page.content: Much of the care in the community is provided by volunteer groups,many being run by local churches. One such group is "Careline" which provides 30 visitors for elderly or house-bound people in need.There is a co_ordinator to put people in touch with help.Local scout and guide groups are run to cater for boys and girls of school age, offering camping trips and leisure activities."Pathfinders" and C.Y.F.A. groups organise activities for teenagers connected with the Anglican churches.Mothers with young babies and toddlers can enjoy such groups as "The Rainbow Club" where large play apparatus is provided as an introduction to nursery and school life.A number of action groups have recently been formed to help the un_ employed.With local sponsorship, several workshops have been acquired.
